title: New currency symbols...
content:
Interesting currency symbol redesigns, not sure they'll catch on...

[http://www.ascendercorp.com/pr/2009-04-01/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019153429/http:/www.ascendercorp.com/pr/2009-04-01/ "http://www.ascendercorp.com/pr/2009-04-01/")
author: Si_Daniels

comments.content: It seems like half a solution to me...
It’s almost as if it was designed by committee but only half the members showed up to the meetings.

i liked this one a bit better:  
 [http://fleuron.com/uncategorized/world-currency-symbol.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019153429/http:/fleuron.com/uncategorized/world-currency-symbol.htm "http://fleuron.com/uncategorized/world-currency-symbol.htm")

I think someone missed the point....

[http://www.ascendercorp.com/custom/currency/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019153429/http:/www.ascendercorp.com/custom/currency/)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~

[_...from the Fontry_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019153429/http:/www.thefontry.com/)

The problem is that Ascendor left out the information on the government bailout. After thr bailout, all users of the revised currency marks will receice the remaining portions of the symbols as part of a tax refund. The removed portions will be returned for closure.

ChrisL
